bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Probate or administration granted to an attorney
bcl:section.bcl:text: If probate or letters of administration have been granted to a person as attorney for some other person, sectionsÂ 1 to 4 apply as if the payments made or acts done under the grant had been made or done under a power of attorney of which that other person was the donor.

subsection.subsectiontext: The authority of an attorney given by a written power of attorney that

paragraph.paragraphtext: provides that the authority is to continue despite any mental infirmity of the donor, and
is signed by the donor and by a witness to the signature of the donor, other than the attorney or the spouse of the attorney,

section.parasandwich: is not terminated only because of subsequent mental infirmity that would but for this Act terminate the authority.

subsection.subsectiontext: The authority of an attorney given by a power of attorney referred to in subsection (1) terminates

paragraph.paragraphtext: on the making of an order under section 3 of the Patients Property Act,
on the appointment of a committee under section 6 (1) of that Act, or
as provided in section 19 (a) or 19.1 (3) (a) of that Act.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Attorney must not make a will for adult
bcl:section.bcl:text: An attorney must not make or change a will for the adult for whom the attorney is acting, and any will or change that is made for an adult by his or her attorney has no force or effect.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: A marriage ends for the purposes of this section when an agreement, judgment or order referred to in section 56 of the Family Relations Act is first made in respect of the marriage.
A marriage-like relationship ends for the purposes of this section when the parties to the marriage-like relationship stop cohabiting with each other, with the intention of ending the relationship.
